TopicTitle: Five motes in God's eye: An attempt at the Jool-5 challenge, Jebediah level

Articles.Content:
Story #1

**Edited <time datetime="2015-05-30T02:04:05Z" title="05/30/2015 02:04  AM" data-short="9 yr">May 30, 2015</time> by Dawnstar**
Hilarious. I would have repped you for the Latin alone. Hope you make it!

Story #2

**Edited <time datetime="2015-05-30T02:04:53Z" title="05/30/2015 02:04  AM" data-short="9 yr">May 30, 2015</time> by Dawnstar**
you sir, rescued my day! thank you!
Outstanding mission, and the most entertaining/informative report I've ever seen. May the grey eyes always shine brightly upon your missions!
Hey! Pretty cool and funny mission! Can you please upload the normal screenshots too so people can check fuel consumption too?

Nice, and now youve made me want to do interplanetary missions, its good to know of someone who doesnt like to leave LKO.

Jeb. I see you are a skyrim fan.

> 
> Hey! Pretty cool and funny mission! Can you please upload the normal screenshots too so people can check fuel consumption too?

Thanks!

I took screenshots exclusively with Alt-F12. While I do have the full-screen, original images, I would be very sorry if the pictures above didn't give you a very full idea, especially for Laythe and Tylo. Just to double-down on the most difficult missions, here are full-screens for the first two landings on both.

Laythe, first landing

[![5117full28c-Laythe-landing.jpg](http://hostingd.imagecross.com/image-hosting-th-07/5117full28c-Laythe-landing.jpg)](http://www.imagecross.com/d/image-hosting-view-07.php?id=5117full28c-Laythe-landing.jpg) Click Image to Enlarge [Image Hosting](http://www.imagecross.com/)

Laythe, reorbit

[![3874full31reorbit.jpg](http://hostingd.imagecross.com/image-hosting-th-07/3874full31reorbit.jpg)](http://www.imagecross.com/d/image-hosting-view-07.php?id=3874full31reorbit.jpg) Click Image to Enlarge [Image Hosting](http://www.imagecross.com/)

Tylo, shortly after separation from Atrytone

[![2644full55a-tylo-landing.jpg](http://hostingd.imagecross.com/image-hosting-th-07/2644full55a-tylo-landing.jpg)](http://www.imagecross.com/d/image-hosting-view-07.php?id=2644full55a-tylo-landing.jpg) Click Image to Enlarge [Image Hosting](http://www.imagecross.com/)

Tylo, landed, fuel status

[![1840full55b-tylo-landing.jpg](http://hostingd.imagecross.com/image-hosting-th-07/1840full55b-tylo-landing.jpg)](http://www.imagecross.com/d/image-hosting-view-07.php?id=1840full55b-tylo-landing.jpg) Click Image to Enlarge [Image Hosting](http://www.imagecross.com/)

Tylo, about to re dock with the Atrytone

[![3652full31reorbit.jpg](http://hostingd.imagecross.com/image-hosting-th-07/3652full31reorbit.jpg)](http://www.imagecross.com/d/image-hosting-view-07.php?id=3652full31reorbit.jpg) Click Image to Enlarge [Image Hosting](http://www.imagecross.com/)

If there are any other part of the sequence where doubt might be entertained, I'll provide the relevant images. However, I do not wish to dump everything into an imgur folder. I think that interface is crap for story-telling, and telling a story is why I participated in the challenge.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-04-16T16:24:29Z" title="04/16/2015 04:24  PM" data-short="9 yr">April 16, 2015</time> by Dawnstar**
Your mission looks cool and your report is fun to read, but there really isn't enough info to verify your fuel consumption.

That was a very interesting mission report. Loved the ship and the images. Although there's some gaps in your fuel/dv info, it appears legit. According to the Dv map, and using the difference between landing and orbital stats, you had enough fuel for all burns that had enough stats to do the math on. So in my modest opinion, this is a successful Jool 5!

Hey Dawnstar, pretty cool mission and story but I have to check your fuel consumption throughout your mission to see if you progressed as it is in the pictures.

So I mean fuel levels for your main ship, and when and how you refueled from your main ship (if you did), etc... if you just upload all your mission pictures into an imgur album without any additional text will do well.

It's good if you have your fuel levels window opened but not necessary - in other missions I already recognized cheating on the small fuel indicators on the left side too! ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

This is important because hyperediting the different ships into different orbits or magically refueling them is easy. But JOOL-5 is a hard challenge and the badge can only be earned if it was done as a real space mission.

So if you can't provide those pictures then I can't accept this mission!
hm, your pictures disappeared, do you know that?
